title: (Reactive Oracle Client) HR000061: Session is currently connecting to database
body:
### Describe the bug

I have currently spinned up a Quarkus project using the latest version 2.7.1. This is what I have included in my project (dependencies): Mutiny, smallrye-reactive-messaging-kafka, reactive-oracle-client & hibernate-reactive-panache.

I have been testing out the new reactive Oracle client and I seem to be having some issues when incorporated with reactive messaging. The flow is as follows: Message is received -> message is processed -> message is then sent to DB -> message ack() is called. The problem here is that whenever I try to insert a record into the database I am met with this error: 
`HR000061: Session is currently connecting to database`

I have looked at this previously reported similar issue but it doesn't justify my criteria: [14709](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/14709)

This is how I have my repository set up:
```
@ApplicationScoped
class SomeRepository : PanacheRepository<SomeEntity>

class SomeRepositoryAdapter(
    private val someRepository: SomeRepository
) : TransactionRepository<SomeEntity> {

    override fun save(entity: SomeEntity): Uni<Void> =
        Panache.withTransaction {
            someRepository.persist(entity)
        }.chain { -> someRepository.flush() }

    override fun saveAll(entities: List<SomeEntity>): Uni<Void> =
        Panache.withTransaction {
            someRepository.persist(entities)
        }.call { -> someRepository.flush() }
}
```

And this is how I have my KafkaEventHandler set up:
```
class KafkaEventHandler(
    private val processor: ProcessMessages,
) : TransactionEventHandler<Message<Notification>, Uni<Void>> {
    @Incoming(KAFKA_DATA)
    @Acknowledgment(Acknowledgment.Strategy.MANUAL)
    override fun consume(record: Message<Notification>): Uni<Void> {
        val metadata = record.getMetadata(IncomingKafkaRecordMetadata::class.java).orElse(null)
        if (metadata != null) {
            log.debug(
                "Received Kafka Record - " +
                    "topic: {}, " +
                    "partition: {}, " +
                    "offset: {}, " +
                    "payload: {}",
                metadata.topic, metadata.partition, metadata.offset, record.payload
            )
        }
        return Uni.createFrom().voidItem()
            .call { -> processor.processMessage(record.payload) }
            .call { -> handleSuccess(record) }
            .onFailure().recoverWithUni { failure -> handleFailure(failure, record) }
    }
}
```

### Expected behavior

For the transaction to be inserted into the database successfully.

### Actual behavior


### How to Reproduce?

1. Create a Quarkus Application with version 2.7.1 and include these dependencies: Mutiny, smallrye-reactive-messaging-kafka, reactive-oracle-client & hibernate-reactive-panache.
2. Set up a basic reactive Kafka consumer/producer using Mutiny
3. Set up a basic Oracle database in a dockerized environment
4. Proceed to send a message to Kafka locally and wait for the consumer to process and send the message to the database
